metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2775 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in GNU Mailman before 2.1.20, when not using a static alias, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in a list name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mailman - 1:2.1.16-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mailman package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.1.16-2ubuntu0.1').
